title: Do you have to "believe in God" to Be a Christian? with John Vervaeke and Rafe Kelley
description:
This follows up on the last Rafe Kelley conversation. Rafe is figuring how what he does believe and should believe. I think this conversation touches on many of the issues that many people are facing today. 

@John Vervaeke  channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/johnvervaeke
Rafe Kelley's Channel https://www.youtube.com/user/Faelcind

Notes
The Spell of the Sensuous by David Abram

The problem with the way of knowing that doesn't put you into right relationship with the surrounding world

Da'ath, faith, continuity that brings right relationship

Object oriented ontology, speculative realism, Critical of corrolationism 

The only ontology that we admit is our experience, our experience shouldn't constitute half of ontology

Getting us into the right relationship with reality as reality. 

Wisdom way of knowing, Wisdom of Jesus,

https://slatestarcodex.com/2019/10/30/new-atheism-the-godlessness-that-failed/

Leonard Cohen Hallelujah 

Christianity as our cultural father

Christianity and pluralism

God sacrificed his son

Compelling but not compulsive

Characterlogical level and the scientific level

JV talking to JBP on May 30

Inverted Pascal's wager

Science may only be a be able to exist in the right religious framework

Dewey: democracy and science

Hyper-objects

You need distributed cognition in order to process hyper objects

Democracy and science need distributed cognition to get us in right relationship with hyper objects

Neo-platonism within Christianity

A story, like the story of Christ becomes necessary for the movement to move through a society

Joseph Henrick's argument in the secret to our success

Culture evolve through a Darwinian process

Christianity resurrection: Chesterton

Center: Jesus

Reformation or Axial revolution

Definitive argument: not fundamentalism or utopianism

Jordan Hall rate of change

Conservatism or emergence

Sufficient differences of degree become differences in kind
